distribution.text: Copyright Â© Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
An update for flatpak is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Flatpak is a system for building, distributing, and running sandboxed desktop applications on Linux.

Security Fix(es):

* flatpak: "file forwarding" feature can be used to gain unprivileged access to files (CVE-2021-21381)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: flatpak security update

notes.text: A sandbox escape flaw was found in the way flatpak handled special tokens in ".desktop" files. This flaw allows an attacker to gain access to files that are not ordinarily allowed by the app's permissions. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality and integrity.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: flatpak: "file forwarding" feature can be used to gain unprivileged access to files
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This is essentially a sandbox escape flaw and needs a malicious app publisher to execute the exploit.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

Avoid installing Flatpak apps from untrusted sources, or check the contents of the exported .desktop files in exports/share/applications/*.desktop (typically ~/.local/share/flatpak/exports/share/applications/*.desktop and /var/lib/flatpak/exports/share/applications/*.desktop) to make sure that literal filenames do not follow @@ or @@u.

vulnerabilities.title: flatpak: "file forwarding" feature can be used to gain unprivileged access to files
